message:
Tulkarm, West Bank: Palestinian media reports that the last night Palestinian Authority's Security Services killed Ahmed Abu Al-Ful, the commander of the "death squads" in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad in Tulkarm.

Hamas and the Islamic Jihad issued proclamations in which they strongly condemned the PA.
Local organizations in Tulkarm called for demonstrations against the Palestinian Authority.

The spokesman for the PA's Security Services presented the its version of the events:

Abu Al-Ful fired at a PA patrol and they returned fire at the source of the shooting.

message:
The President of Colombia, Gustavo Petro, announced today during a speech in De Bolivar Square, on the occasion of Workers' Day, that starting tomorrow Colombia will sever diplomatic ties with Israel due to the war in Gaza.

##
The Colombian military industry will be less than happy with the announcement...

message:
Following the report yesterday 👆

IDF: For the first time since the beginning of the war: The Erez Crossing has been opened for the entry of humanitarian aid

According to the government directive, and as part of the effort to increase the quantity and routes for humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip, for the first time since the beginning of the war, the IDF, through the Coordination of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT), opened the Erez Crossing of the Ministry of Defense's Land Crossings Authority today (Wednesday), to allow the entry of humanitarian aid into the Gaza Strip. As part of this effort, after careful security inspection, 30 trucks of humanitarian aid including food and medical supplies for the northern part of the Gaza Strip, arrived from Jordan and entered Gaza today.

The entry of humanitarian aid through the Erez Crossing was made possible after engineering work was carried out in the area by the Engineering Units and additional IDF forces.
event_breakdown: - Opening of Erez Crossing for entry of humanitarian aid into Gaza Strip

message:
Pro-Palestinian students yesterday took down the American flag at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and raised the Palestinian flag in its place.
County police officers arrived at the scene and re-raised the American flag. The pro-Israeli students stood there with Israeli flags and sang the American national anthem (as you can see in the attached video) in front of the American flag that was raised at the top of the mast.

Immediately after that, the pro-Palestinians tried to remove the American flag again, and then the students in the picture came and raised the American flag and prevented the flag from touching the floor.

##
The Americans are very sensitive to the issue of the flag and in my opinion the pro-Palestinians' injury to it plays against them in American public opinion. The pro-Israel American students made sure to show their respect for American symbols. There are many merits here for Israel and the Jewish community.
location: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
event_breakdown:
- Pro-Palestinian students took down the American flag at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and raised the Palestinian flag
- County police officers arrived at the scene and re-raised the American flag
- Pro-Israeli students stood with Israeli flags and sang the American national anthem in front of the American flag
- Pro-Palestinians tried to remove the American flag again, but other students raised it and prevented it from touching the ground

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Vahid Tefili, born in 2000 from the village of Deir al-Zahrani in southern Lebanon.

Vahid was seriously injured more than four days ago and died tonight from his wounds. The circumstances of his death are not specified.
In addition to being a Hezbollah military operative, he was a "commander" in the local Hezbollah scout tribe.

Number 291

message:
The Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (affiliated with Hezbollah) publishes the details of the Israeli proposal that it claims was submitted to Hamas through Egypt on April 26:

First stage (40 days - subject to extension)

The Israeli forces will withdraw from the densely populated areas (not from Netzarim Corridor).
Aircraft traffic in the Gaza Strip will be suspended for 8-10 hours every day.
The displaced citizens will be able to return to their homes.
On the seventh day after the release of the women among the abductees, IDF forces will clear the coastal axis to allow the movement of humanitarian aid.
On the 22nd, after the release of two-thirds of the agreed upon hostages, the IDF forces will withdraw from Netzarim Corridor. At this stage, it will be possible to bring in 500 aid trucks a day, 50 of which will be diesel for the operation of the power plant in Gaza. Heavy equipment will also be brought into the Gaza Strip to clear the rubble and the hospitals, clinics will be retrained and the bakeries all over the strip.

During this period, Hamas will release at least 33 abductees under the category: women, children up to the age of 19, adults over the age of 50, sick and wounded.
Israel will release 20 Palestinian prisoners for each abductee, in a matching category: women and children for women and children. Adults against adults, when the proportion of 20 prisoners is kept for each abductee.
In this category, Palestinian prisoners whose remaining sentence exceeds 10 years will not be released.

Soldiers category:
For each kidnapped female soldier, 20 prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment and another 20 prisoners with up to 10 years remaining in prison will be released. Israel has the right to veto the names of the prisoners up to 200 names cumulatively.
The prisoners will be released to the Gaza Strip or abroad.

Rate of release: Hamas will release 3 Israeli hostages every 3 days.
The Palestinian prisoners who will be released will not be able to be re-arrested for the crimes they committed before their prison term (ie they will receive amnesty).

Starting on the 14th, there was an agreement for more wounded military operatives, according to an agreed list, to go through the Rafah crossing for medical treatment abroad.

Second stage of the agreement (42 days)

The completion of the agreement for a comprehensive calm (ceasefire) and its announcement before the release of surviving abductees (men and soldiers) in exchange for the release of additional Palestinian prisoners.
The beginning of the necessary arrangements for the total rehabilitation of the strip.

Step 3 of the agreement (42 days)
Kidnapped-prisoner body swap.
Beginning of the implementation of a 5-year rehabilitation plan for the Strip.
event_breakdown:
- Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper publishes Israeli proposal details to Hamas through Egypt on April 26
- First stage of the proposal (40 days)
  - Israeli forces withdraw from densely populated areas except Netzarim Corridor
  - Aircraft traffic in Gaza Strip suspended for 8-10 hours daily
  - Displaced citizens allowed to return home
  - IDF forces clear coastal axis after release of women abductees
  - IDF withdraws from Netzarim Corridor after release of two-thirds of hostages
  - Incoming aid includes 500 trucks/day, medical equipment, and humanitarian aid
  - Hamas releases abductees based on categories
  - Israel releases Palestinian prisoners in matching categories
  - Soldiers category: specific conditions for release
  - Rate of release: 3 Israeli hostages every 3 days
  - Wounded military operatives allowed to go abroad for treatment

- Second stage of the agreement (42 days)
  - Comprehensive calm (ceasefire) announced before release of remaining abductees
  - Preparations for total rehabilitation of Gaza Strip begin

- Step 3 of the agreement (42 days)
  - Kidnapped-prisoner body swap
  - Implementation of a 5-year rehabilitation plan for Gaza Strip begins

message:
The operation in Rafah - the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (Hezbollah-affiliated) from its sources:

The US demands that Israel evacuate at least 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before the attack in the area. 40,000 tents arrived in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates. Each tent can accommodate 20 people (a total of 800,000 people).

There is a concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs in the southern area of ​​the Gaza Strip (on the Israeli side).
Israel is planning to break into Rafah from the area of ​​the Sofa crossing and the Kerem Shalom crossing.

The Egyptians asked to check with the leadership of Hamas, whether its military arm is planning to blow up the fences in the border area with Egypt in order to cause crowds to flee to Egyptian territory.
event_breakdown:
1. US demands Israel evacuate 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before the attack.
2. 40,000 tents arrive in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates.
3. Concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles in southern Gaza Strip.
4. Israel plans to break into Rafah from Sofa crossing and Kerem Shalom crossing.
5. Egyptians inquire with Hamas leadership about potential border disturbances with Egypt.

Is the Iranian deterrence working?

It is worth noting they are members of the same force (Israeli Border Police) that was attacked.

message:
The Israel Police publishes CCTV footage of today's stabbing attack near the Flowers Gate in the Old City of Jerusalem.

The Turkish terrorist stalked the two police officers from behind, and then pulled out a knife and started stabbing one of two.

Thankfully the officers managed to fight him off, sustaining only minor injuries.

As previously mentioned, the terrorist was shot and killed.

- Police officers fighting off the attacker with minor injuries
- Terrorist shot and killed by the police
